titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James F. Kelly Brooklyn Navy Yard collection 1987.018
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-09-19 14:08:36 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: James F. Kelly Brooklyn Navy Yard collection
did.abstract: The collection contains four items relating to James F. Kelly's time working at the Brooklyn Navy Yard.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Helen Quigley and Teresa MacDonald, 1987.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); James F. Kelly Brooklyn Navy Yard collection, 1987.018, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: These materials were donated along with six artifacts which were transferred to the museum collection under the object ID prefix M1987.98, as well as 22 volumes of The Shipworker, which is available at CBH on microfilm (Microfilm Reel 1-4).
This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Veronica Kieffer Brooklyn Navy Yard photograph and badge (V1988.047)
Brooklyn Navy Yard publications and ephemera collection (ARC.222)
Evelyn Rudon Brooklyn Navy Yard collection (ARC.076)
Thomas J. Nerney Brooklyn Navy Yard papers (ARC.072)
Solomon C. Frucht Brooklyn Navy Yard ephemera (1987.050)
Brooklyn Navy Yard oral history collection (ARC.003)
Anthony Costanzo Brooklyn Navy Yard collection (ARC.023)
Celestine De Martini Brooklyn Navy Yard collection (ARC.029)
John McTernan Brooklyn Navy Yard collection (ARC.065)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a certificate for an award presented to James F. Kelly from the Department of the Navy; his identification badge; a program for the commissioning ceremony of the U.S.S. Independence; and a copy of a publication titled National Association of Supervisors: 1952 Review.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
